required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of CC-90001 in Subjects With Non-alcoholic Steatohepatitis (NASH) and Stage 3 or Stage 4 Liver Fibrosis
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Multicenter, Adaptive, Dose-Finding Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of CC-90001 in Subjects With Non-alcoholic Steatohepatitis (NASH) and F3 or F4 Liver Fibrosis

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a Phase 2, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, multicenter, multinational, dose-finding study evaluating the efficacy of three treatment doses of CC-90001 (100 mg, 200 mg and 400 mg PO QD), compared with placebo, in NASH subjects with Stage 3 and Stage 4 fibrosis.
This study is designed to assess response to treatment on measures of fibrosis and other efficacy parameters. It will also assess dose response and overall safety.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects who achieve a ≥1 stage improvement in liver fibrosis
primary_outcome.description: Assessment of liver fibrosis score by the NASH Clinical Research Network (CRN) scoring system

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects who achieve a ≥1 stage improvement in liver fibrosis and no worsening of steatohepatitis
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of liver fibrosis score and steatohepatitis

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with an improvement of ≥2 points in the
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of Nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) activity score (NAS) and liver fibrosis score

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects who demonstrate absence of steatohepatitis and no worsening of liver fibrosis
Proportion of subjects who progress to cirrhosis
Proportion of subjects who achieve the relative reductions in liver stiffness
Percentage change from Baseline in liver stiffness
Proportion of subjects who achieve the relative reductions fat fraction
Percentage change from Baseline in fat fraction
Changes from baseline in liver biochemistry
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of liver biochemistry (AST, ALT, GGT)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in metabolic parameters
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of metabolic parameters (LDL, HDL, triglycerides)

secondary_outcome.measure: Dose-related changes in the primary and secondary endpoints
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of liver fibrosis score by dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Adverse Event (AE)
secondary_outcome.description: Type, frequency, severity, and relationship of adverse events (AEs) to CC-90001

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics - Cmax
Pharmacokinetics - AUC
Pharmacokinetics - Tmax
Pharmacokinetics - t1/2
Pharmacokinetics - CL/F
Pharmacokinetics - Vz/F
Dose-related changes in the primary and secondary endpoints
Dose-related changes in the primary and secondary endpoints

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Key Inclusion Criteria Diagnosis of non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) with presence of Stage 3 or Stage 4 fibrosis based of the non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) Clinical Research Network (CRN) Histologic Scoring System and a nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) Activity Score (NAS) of 4 or higher
Exclusion Criteria:
- Key Exclusion Criteria
1. History or evidence of decompensated liver disease,
2. Hepatitis and fibrosis more likely related to etiologies other than non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH).
3. Subject has urine ethyl glucuronide (EtG) > 500 ng/mL at Screening.
4. History or positive screen for human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection or congenital or human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)-unrelated acquired immunodeficiencies (eg, common variable immunodeficiency [CVID]).
5. History of hepatitis B and/or hepatitis C.
6. History of malignancy (exceptions: excised and cured basal/squamous cell skin carcinomas and cervical carcinoma in situ with no recurrence in 5 years).
7. Pregnancy or lactation.
